so legend game

Finally got around to beating this game after many years since Bioshock 1 and 2. The story was not my favorite but it still is well done and if you can pull symbolism out of details that seem insignificant you should be able to enjoy this game. 

The main campaign while the majority of my time in this game was very Bioshock in layout and traversing it. The sky hook I felt is underutilized while the Vigors did not seem to have the same heft and synergy as they did in the first two games. The areas were different enough that you could traverse them without much assistance from the navigation button (N by default on M+K), which was a great change as the constant arrow pointing you in the right direction was less than enjoyable.

Clash in the Clouds I played 2 waves worth and shelved it. Its not bad from the couple of rounds but I wasn't interested in playing a wave arcade based DLC at this time.

Burial at Sea 1 and 2 were fantastic fun to play and much more of a challenge compared to the main campaign. Both brought about 10 hours of playtime as well as spoilers to the main game. Highly suggest playing the main campaign first before either DLC.

Played on Medium difficulty and Mouse and Keyboard.

You know the level design and the narrative are awesome when they blend into an extraordinary experience when you find little tidbits of information (like in the first game, Atlas wife and kid name were seem in a poster in the theater as stars) that scratch the barrier of the storytelling initially provided to you just enough to make you suspicious that nothing is what it truly looks like. And when the tension rises and pieces come together, seeing your suspicions confirmed you can't help but smirk a little. It's the massive attention to detail that distinguishes great games from absolute works of art. Especially because games like these require you to pay attention to all details or you may lose the grip on the plot (although the first half is pretty simplistic if you ask me).

By the way, there's a "Easter Egg" for "Girls just wanna have fun" by "Cindy Lauper" somewhere in the game. I fell of my chair laughing when I found it 10/10

This game is very fun. I only really have two complaints about the game. 1: The story which almost makes sense except for weird time travel rules and principles gone largely unexplained which make the ending not make complete sense. The whole ending almost sours the experience especially considered how much stronger the story was up until that point. My second problem is "Why is this a Bioshock Game." If you argue that it is about the idea of there being a "utopian" city gone wrong with a prominent leader and the systemshock/bioshock plasmid mechanics, then yes I'd be fine with it being a bioshock game. The problem comes when they try to connect the 2 games to each other without explaining it all that well and it really feels out of place and again detracts from the overall experience. The vigors in this game don't feel as good as the Plasmids in Bioshock, the 2 weapon limit kinda kills some of the fun, the gun upgrade system is dumb, and the whole lose money when you die thing is a little annoying but understandable. I'm really just nitpicking though. This game is very good. 8.7/10
Awesome

第九艺术，神作（我心目中的神作）（推荐分数满分，一定要玩的神作，不买后悔。）

一改生化奇兵1那阴冷的画面，这作的无限城有着明亮的风光，没得出奇，我相信游戏开头玩家坐火箭一直攀升至最高点到达无限城的瞬间，是让人难忘的瞬间，从湿冷阴暗的雨天突破云端到达无限城就像我们从1的海底世界到达了这一代的天空之城哥伦比亚。
作为一款有些年头的游戏，画面并不过时，画风十分讨喜。

在剧情上这是我玩到过的最棒的剧情（生化奇兵1和无限就是一个整体，推荐一同购买游玩），从传统剧情上和内涵意义上都是几乎完美的。平行时空的设定更是眼前一亮，而肯列文也做到游戏在剧情上几乎没有bug，一切都能说过去的设定和走向。

作为一款游戏，在玩法上也十分出色，保留了一代的枪械加异能，多种异能和武器以及套装的搭配，给了玩家不同的玩法选择，你可以主枪械异能辅助，也可以主异能枪械辅助，甚至可以一路近战平a地形杀过去，可以说玩法多样了。

生化奇兵的剧情永远是深刻，不管是一代的客观主义和利己资本主义，还是这一代的宗教，生化奇兵在反乌托邦上总事能让人深思。

生化奇兵无限给我带来的不仅仅是一个游戏，一段故事，它还给我带来了一个活生生的女孩——伊丽莎白。伊丽莎白可以说是游戏史上塑造的最成功的女性角色之一了，她天真善良，被锁在高塔上等待着玩家拯救，她陪我们一路成长，我们见证了伊丽莎白心理上的成熟，通过海葬dlc，更是完善了伊丽莎白，让她更加的完美真实，哪怕最后几乎成神，也要重返凡胎拯救一个因为自己的复仇欲望而造成悲剧的小女孩，哪怕明知道自己会死，她也要去，伊丽莎白，是真的善良可爱啊。
Oynamanızı kesinlikle önerdiğim hikayesi ilk başlarda anlaşılmayan ama sonunda her şeyin netleştiği bir oyun. Çerezlik gibi 10 saatte bitirip keyfinize bakacağınız bir hikaye.
Хорошый шутер с классной историей без разно образных разветвлений в сюжете в отличае от предыдущих игр но мне все равно нравится.

Colorful, violent, and overwhelmingly beautiful and depressing. In a linear, (mostly) unchanging game, it was entertaining enough to make me play through it three times -- on the hardest difficulty. Few games compel me to try and suck the marrow out like Infinite did.
Great story, okay game play... Beat it on the hardest difficulty it took hours because I loved the game that much, lastly the game is very beautiful. It's worth a buy

《生化奇兵无限》以其剧情和人设而饱受赞誉，我个人也是久仰大名而来。通关游戏本体后，个人给予以下评价
5星满分的话
剧情             ⭐⭐⭐⭐
人物刻画      ⭐⭐⭐
游戏性         ⭐⭐
世界观设计  ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
先说说除了世界观设计的项目，首先听说游戏开发过程中有人员流失而导致的游戏内容删减，我是相信这一点的，因为游戏本身剧情复杂，但是游戏的流程却有些难以支撑，导致最后关于平行世界概念以及各个人物的历程模糊不清。当然，这不是什么大问题，毕竟游戏剧情是完整的，而且也有不少玩家通过重复游玩以及细致的探索补全了剧情上的细节，所以这种朦胧感可以当成这是游戏自身叙事的一种手法。但在人物刻画上，游戏体量的狭小就比较致命了。伊丽莎白是个很有魅力的角色，可惜的是我个人认为《生化奇兵无限》在刻画方面应该能做的更好。（当然本身游戏的刻画是过关的，我只是拿来跟诸如《最后生还者》这样的人物描写来对比了，所以只是有些可惜）
其次是游戏性。个人认为最为一款FPS是不过关的。我全程是用的手柄通关，射击手感比较烂，关卡设计和敌人AI设计都并不优秀，
异能还算有趣多变，但是枪械只能捡而且只能带两把在身上就比较不爽了，这也导致不敢随便换枪，所以很多枪都没怎么用过，看起来也没什么卵用。
最后，必需一提的游戏的世界观设计。游戏本身是基于一个蒸汽朋克的世界观，核心却是反乌托邦，又融入了魔幻色彩和平行世界的概念，创意满满而且所有元素融合的及其融洽。美丽的机械天空城设定我就很喜欢，而在其美丽的背后则是一个宗教统治和集权政治体的黑暗面。而作为反对势力的革命党虽然是为自身的自由奋斗，但其本质不过也是另一个人性丑恶的化身罢了。全游戏我最喜欢的台词并不是开局的“你畏惧神明吗？不，我畏惧你”而是布克的那句“独裁者和革命者的区别只在于他们名字的拼写”（原台词说的是他们的名字）。而游戏随处可见的对于种族歧视，政治洗脑的讽刺，更是让我不经感叹在现在这个无论国内国外都到处都是政治正确和文字狱的时代，估计很难再有这么敢讲的游戏了。
强烈推荐

Originally I gave this game low marks, but the more I think about it, the more it seems to only have one bad DLC: Clash in the Clouds (CitC). The main game actually has one of my favorite scenes of all the mountain of games I've played. (The scene right after Monument Island)
As for Burial at Sea (DLC), those episodes are pretty fun, too, and they offer a unique experience from the main game.

Overall I'd recommend this game now, but the CitC was terribly designed.

ORIGINAL REVIEW:
I spend 2 hours getting to wave 14/15 on one of the DLCs, and the game closes itself and apologizes. It just goes to show you how little they care about the gamer, not to mention the fact that we have to get stuck listening to their insulting remarks every time we lose a battle. Plus, once you die once, you can't get the blue ribbon for the level unless you start over at wave 1.

The main game itself is awesome, but the Clash in the Clouds DLC is pure shit made to piss on people and stuff cash in their pockets.

Just wow! The graphics are something I rarely saw in other games. The story starts normal but ends with a twist no one saw coming. All of it is a pleasure to play.

If you buy it, be sure to get the DLCs while you're at it.

If your only going to read the first line of this review then yes get the game its worth it, if you wanna know more about my reasoning and my negatives then feel free to read on.

first the good news, this game has a lot of positives to show off, one that stands out quite literally would be the games art style i find myself saying this a lot but it really is satisfying, I've found myself standing in the games environment and just admiring it sometimes. Also the games colour pallet matches perfectly with the art style to create a visual experience you wont find in many games let alone first person shooters.

The gun play also feels great, the guns feel responsive and most importantly fun to use. There is also a variety of weapons that i did not expect, which really was a welcome surprise, yes some guns feel like re skins but the obvious differences in each guns strengths and weaknesses really gives some tense, on the spot decision making as you pick what guns to partner up and take with you as you can only hold two guns, which may seem negative however the element of strategy it introduced when deciding on what guns to use was fun.

lastly I'm going to avoid spoilers but the story is really compelling, in the beginning it seems like you can brush it off and just kind of enjoy the core gameplay, which, don't get me wrong you can, but towards the end of the game there are so many different factors that come into play, making it a really cool and complex sci-fi story that to be honest you'll have to watch a youtube video to understand, however i do recommend purchasing the burial at sea expansion as it really does add a lot to the story and makes the game feel alot more complete.

Now the ugly part the criticisms, some of which are very nit picky. The main issue i feel i had with the game was, at times, it felt very repetitive, the reason i say this is at times i did feel i would come across a wave of enemies and say "not again", usually i can enjoy or live through wave based shooters, for example doom eternal however something in this game felt off, like the enemies just kept coming and coming, which can be easily looked past however it was one thing that did prevent me from many long sessions of playing the game.

My last little criticism would be simply the overwhelming aspect of ammo management but not particularly in a great way, the game is a high flying action game, your shooting all the time however the momentum can be broken once you lose ammo and it can bug you as a player every now and then but like my other criticism can be looked passed.

Overall i really do think you should get this game if you have any sort of liking towards first persons shooters as the game is different due to the vigors (sort of magical abilities that can be used in combat) and even past that the guns feel fun and responsive so i don't see any reason to not pick this up, especially in a sale as it usually drops to £4.99 or below or £9.99 as part of the Bioshock collection so, a must have.

This is sadly a Bioshock game in name only, as this merely happens in the same universe as the older games, though the term "universe", might be a slight misnomer in this case, and this game shares some elements from earlier games with different names and implementations. This game is fine for casual gamers, as this is mostly a generic fps-shooter with linear level design, but players who are looking for more action oriented games might want to steer clear from this (and no, having a hidden way to unlock hardest difficulty with Konami code doesn't make this game hardcore). I'm giving this a negative review purely because this game is a downgrade from previous games from a gameplay perspective and because this game tries too hard to be intellectual piece of art, but falls flat as infinite dissections of this game's plot have already proven.

Gameplay of this game is basically a regular FPS game, with powers ("magic") you can use against your enemies. Alternative ammo crafting from previous games is completely gone and Gene Tonics ("Passives") are no longer behind inventory and monetary management, but instead given at you at certain sections and you can change your passives whenever you want. You can no longer collect health and "mana" items so there isn't really any inventory management in this game.  Hacking minigame is also gone and replaced with one-time currency based lockpick system (ie. you use certain amount of collected lockpicks to instantly open locks). Research system is also gone as is the intense atmosphere of dark insane underwater city. The new skyhook system is kind of neat but it really only makes you overpowered. This games is also very linear in its level design, which was kind of a bummer as earlier games weren't nearly as linear as this was. Little nickpicks include following: you cannot manually save as apparently people can get stuck with manual saves (which is more of an issue with autosaves getting you stuck in a glitch), you can carry two weapons and this game is obviously designed for consoles as some menus in inventory are unintuitive to navigate with KB+M.

This game is a decent casual shooter, but a big disappointment for a sequel and for all the hype it got.

The bioshock franchise is hands down my favourite game series period.  The third installment is no different, and was actually the first one i played in its entirety and therefore holds a special place in my heart!  I love this series mainly for its story and the immersive world(s) theyve created as well as what was a really really unique gameplay especially when it came out.  the mental mind frick can be nice too :)

Anyone who loves a good story and games that really well and truly immerse the player should absolutely try out the bioshock series!  
You dont NEED to play the first two to enjoy infinite, in fact I might even suggest playing infinite first, as infinite stands on its own very well, but the entire lore is connected throughout the first three and to get the entire story you really need all three (heres hoping for the fourth soon!)

Bioshock rien que ce nom a une histoire vidéo ludique colossale.
Parlons un peut de l’histoire qui est magnifique et dont je ne m’attendais pas à une fin pareille.
Le jeu sorti en 2013 est nous somme en 2020 n’a pas prit une ride graphisme éblouissant jouabilité énorme être limité en nombre d’arme (deux) et devoir chercher l’arme appropriée à chacune des situations augmente la difficulté de jeu.
J’aurai pour ma par crée plusieurs fins possibles à bioshock infinity se qui irons jusqu’au bout de jeux comprendrons.
J’ai jouer au deux premier volé est la saga ne ma pas dessus je ne peut qu’une nouvelle fois recommander d’essayer cette expérience vidéo ludique tout simplement sublime .

This is definitely one of the best story games I have ever played, if not the best. In that sense, it is a masterpiece. The combat is highly addictive and the visuals are great. The beautifully designed fantasy setting will compel you to explore the world with a childish fascination in everything around you. The protagonists, Dewitt, whom you play as, and Elizabeth, the young lady that appears on the game's cover-photo, are extremely well developed (in terms of characterization) and genuinely interesting. The story's immersion is unreal. I completed it in just two playthroughs since I couldn't stop playing. I sat at my desk for 6 consecutive hours, twice. 

Every fan of story games should play this, if not for the story, for the combat which is arguably equally as immersive.
Masterpiece.

Gran historia junto con una gran jugabilidad sin duda te mantiene atento a cada giro y por su puesto esperando el gran final

Замечательная во многих аспектах история, которая пробирает до глубины души и навсегда остается в сердце каждого игрока. Самая настоящая частичка видеоигрового искусства, с которой стоит ознакомиться. В игре прекрасно всё, кроме наудушнейшей концовки. Объем финальных сражений напоминает скорее потнейший геноцид, от которого я знатно осел. В остальном же, минусов не заметил, рекомендую всем, кто по каким-то причинам ещё не прошел.
